javadoc:
Class that uses JavaHelp browser to show context sensitive help.

Note: this manager will validate all registered help when in development mode. In order to catch items that have not registered help at all, we rely on those items to register a default {@link HelpLocation} that will get flagged as invalid. Examples of this usage are the {@link DockingActionIf} and the {@link ComponentProvider} base classes.

methods.name: addHelpSet
methods.comment: Add the help set for the given URL.

params.name: classLoader
params.comment: the help classloader that knows how to find help modules in the classpath

throws.comment: if the help set could not be created from the given URL.

methods.name: getHelpLocation
methods.comment:
Returns the Help location associated with the specified object
 or null if no help has been registered for the object.

methods.javadoc: Returns the master help set (the one into which all other help sets are merged).
methods.name: getMasterHelpSet
methods.comment: Returns the master help set (the one into which all other help sets are merged).

methods.name: showHelp
methods.comment:
Display the help page for the given URL.  This is a specialty method for displaying
 help when a specific file is desired, like an introduction page.  Showing help for 
 objects within the system is accomplished by calling 
 #showHelp(Object, boolean, Component).

name: HelpManager
comment:
Class that uses JavaHelp browser to show context sensitive help.
 
 Note: this manager will validate all registered help when in development mode.  In order
 to catch items that have not registered help at all, we rely on those items to register a 
 default HelpLocation that will get flagged as invalid.  Examples of this usage are
 the DockingActionIf and the ComponentProvider base classes.
